newsitem.title: Turkmenistan: Turkmens to get 400,000 tonne/per year steel plant.
newsitem.headline: Turkmens to get 400,000 tonne/per year steel plant.

text.p: Two Turkish firms plan to build a steel plant in Turkmenistan with a capacity of 400,000 tonnes of rolled products a year, the former Soviet republic's state news agency Turkmen-Press said on Monday.

It said Turkey's Export-Import Bank would provide an $80 million credit for the facility, to be built by Turkish companies Asmash and Genay next to a hydro-electric power station near the desert nation's eastern city of Mary.
The agency gave no details on the technology to be used at the plant, which will process steel scrap to produce building materials and pipes.
Turkmenistan will pay back the loan for the plant, the first of its kind in the republic, with finished steel products, according to Turkmen officials.
